title: sasaki_kojirou_(traveling_outfit)_(fate)
body:
[quote]Celebrating Fate/Grand Order's 3rd Anniversary!!!

Let's travel the world to celebrate this great day.
And of course, your Heroic Spirits in their travel outfits will be by your side![/quote]

title: braw_bro
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.  

[b]MAN-03 Braw Bro[/b]

The first [[mobile armor]] designed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] to be used exclusively by newtypes. Created by Zeon's "Flanagan Institute", it has the distinction of being the first mobile weapon to be equipped with the psychic communicator "Psycommu" system for piloting the MA and controlling the only weapons that the Braw Bro was equipped with: four wire-guided units mounting two barrel mega particle guns (top and bottom spars) or single mega particle guns (starboard and port spars). 

The Braw Bro was also designed to separate into different blocks, so that any test data could be preserved. It is operated by [[Challia Bull]].

h4. See also

* [[Kikeroga (GQuuuuuuX)]] - [[Gundam GQuuuuuuX]] counterpart.

A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985).

[b]Ben Wooder[/b] is a serious and cruel [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] ground forces military officer.

His big, [[manly]] and muscular character design with a [[bob cut]] looks somewhat similar to an evil [[He-Man]].

title: neutered_symbol
body:
A variation of the [[mars symbol]] with the circle crossed out with a single diagonal line. This symbol is sometimes tattooed onto male cats and dogs to indicate that they have been fixed. Also known as a sterilization indicator tattoo.

Not to be confused with the [[androgyne symbol]], which is a mars symbol with the line crossed out instead of the circle.

title: edward_teach_(final_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Edward Teach (fate)|]] in his Final Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is a rare instance of a Servant gaining a unique costume for their Final Ascension. Here, Teach's otaku tendencies are shown as he wears modern casual attire consisting of a white t-shirt with a red-and-blue skull pattern on the front, and blue jeans. Starting with [[Servant Summer Festival! 2018]] he's seen wearing a similar shirt but with [[official alternate color|yellow-and-green skulls]] instead paired with [[swim trunks]].

title: musashibou_benkei_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant developed for [[Fate/Apocrypha]] and properly appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[ushiwakamaru (fate)|Ushiwakamaru]] (Minamoto no Yoshitsune)'s retainer, and a warrior monk who is famous for his loyalty and strength.

[spoiler]However, this "Benkei" is not actually the true Benkei himself, but merely an ordinary soldier under Benkei's command who were so impressed with his master's chivalry that, after he survived the downfall of both Yoshitsune and Benkei, he lived the rest of his life of that of Benkei's and spread his tale. Resulting into him being enshrined as the folk hero "Benkei" in the Throne of Heroes.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Terada Katsuya]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Shinjirou]]
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Inada Tetsu]]

title: axis_powers_hetalia
body:
[b]Axis Powers Hetalia (ヘタリア)[/b] is a historical comedy manga and anime series by [[Himaruya Hidekazu]], consisting of vignettes (mainly in a World War II-era setting) acted out by anthropomorphic characters representing the nations of the world.  Most nations actually have full human names, "but those aren't used on Danbooru, not even as aliases":/forum_topics/2192.

title: living_onahole
body:
A type of hentai [[sex]] where a larger person or creature uses a much smaller person or creature to masturbate, by forcefully shoving the smaller actor over their penis. Usually results in ample [[stomach_bulge]]  and/or [[inflation]] as a result.

Some artists take this concept further and create a small person that's a literal onahole from the waist down.

title: type_99_cannon
body:
A 20mm [[autocannon]] used by Japanese fighters and bombers during [[World War II]]. It is based on the [[Oerlikon 20mm gun|Oerlikon series of autocannons]] which are operated by advanced primer ignition blowback.

There are two variants of the Type 99 cannon. The Type 99 Mark 1 is a light weapon but the short barrel and projectile chambered reduced the projectile range and hitting power. It is fed by a drum magazine or later, belt feed. The Type 99 Mark 2 is a heavier weapon which reduced its rate of fire but has a longer barrel and chambered for a longer projectile, making it an effective weapon against allied aircraft. Like the Type 99 Mark 1, it is fed by a drum magazine or later, belt feed.

A heavily modified version of the Type 99 is the primary weapon of most Fusoan witches in the [[World Witches Series]].  

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 99 cannon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_99_cannon

title: sakamoto_mio
body:
Sakamoto Mio (坂本美緒) is a character from [[Strike Witches]] originating from the [[Fuso (strike witches)|]] empire. Her familiar is the Doberman. The squadron leader, she brings together the group with a fatherly atmosphere. 

She has a [[black_hair|black]] [[ponytail]] and is often seen wearing a white naval uniform with a [[school swimsuit]] [[swimsuit_under_clothes|underneath]], as well as an eyepatch that helps regulate usage of her magic eye. She is a part of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], with the role of Major. Her affiliation however is the 288th Fuso Air Force, along with [[Miyafuji Yoshika]].

Her first [[Striker Unit]] was a A6M3a type Zero with with blue stripes on the vertical stabilizer as well as a blue angled stripe that points downward at the front and upward at the back as it's identification stripes. Her second unit is based off of the [i]Kawanishi N1K-J [b]Shiden[/b] (Violet Lightning)[/i]) with a single white angled identification stripe after she started becoming unable to raise proper shields once she reached the age of 20. She also forged a new [[katana]] that she calls Reppumaru, that has the ability to redirect [[Neuroi]] energy beams back to the enemy.

Mio is based on Japanese flying ace [[Sakai Saburou]].

h4. Equipment

* [[Type 99 cannon|13mm Type-99 machine gun]]
* [[katana|Reppumaru]]

title: miyafuji_yoshika
body:
Miyafuji Yoshika is the main character of [[Strike Witches]]. She has short [[brown hair]] and wears a [[school swimsuit]] under her blue [[school uniform]]. She is a part of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]]. Her affiliation however is the 288th Fuso Air Force, along with [[Sakamoto Mio]].

Her first [[Striker Unit]] was a A6M3a type Zero with a single yellow stripe as it's identification stripe. Her second unit was the same type (previously owned by Major Sakamoto Mio until she received a new unit based off of the [i]Kawanishi N1K-J [b]Shiden[/b][/i]) with blue stripes on the vertical stabilizer as well as a blue angled stripe that points downward at the front and upward at the back. 

Her third (and current) striker unit is based on the [i]Kyūshū J7W [b]Shinden[/b][/i]. The [i]Shinden[/i] allows Yoshika to use her magic to her fullest potential, as during episode 8 of the anime (Strike Witches 2) her magic became so strong that the governor installed on Mio's striker unit protected the magic engine from overloading.

Her familiar is the [[shiba inu]].

She has been shown to be [[yuri|attracted to other witches' breasts]], especially [[Lynette Bishop]]'s. Because of that she was given a nickname 淫獣宮藤 (injuu miyafuji, lewd/dirty beast Miyafuji).

h4. Equipment

* [[Type 99 cannon|13mm Type99-2-2 machine gun]]
* M712

title: testudo_formation
body: An army formation used by ancient Romans, meaning "tortoise" in classic Latin. The men in the front would hold their shields forward while the others would hold theirs facing upward, allowing the squad to advance forward while being protected from both frontal attacks as well as ranged attacks from archers and slingers. Sometimes, the squad would also have shieldbearers arranged to also protect the sides and rear as well, at the cost of forward mobility.

title: battle_master
body:
A 2D fighting game released for the [[Super Nintendo]] in 1993, capitalizing on the [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II]] craze.  It was never officially localized in the west.

[[Powudon]] was one of the main developers on the game, being the game design planner, creating all the characters, their moves and did much of the graphic design for the backgrounds, credited under the fake alias "HIROAKI FUJIMOTO" [tn]"[1]":[https://web.archive.org/web/20190913002927/http://powudon.com/gallery/original/BM/makeing.html][/tn][tn]"[2]":[http://gaming.moe/?p=2602][/tn].

Full title: [b]Battle Master: Kyūkyoku no Senshitachi[/b]

h4. External links
* "Powudon Blog: Battle Master":https://web.archive.org/web/20190907144011/http://powudon.com/gallery/original/cg-10battl.htm
other_names: バトルマスター究極の戦士たち

title: darkstalkers
body:
[b]Darkstalkers[/b] is a fighting game series created by [[Capcom]], known in Japan as [b]VAMPIRE[/b] (ヴァンパイア).

h4. Characters

* [[Felicia (darkstalkers)|]] - the catgirl
* [[Hsien-ko]] (Lei Lei in Japan) - The [[jiangshi]]
* [[Morrigan Aensland]] - The succubus, and the progenitor of succubi depictions in Japan
* [[Lilith (darkstalkers)|]] - The flat succubus who was made from Morrigan Aensland's split spirit
* [[Q-Bee]] - The Soul Bee
* [[B.B. Hood]] (Bulleta in Japan) - The psychotic red riding hood
* [[Donovan Baine]] - The demon hunter
* [[Dee (darkstalkers)|]] - A corrupt version of Donovan
* [[Anakaris]] - The mummy
* [[Jon Talbain]] (Gallon in Japan) - The lycanthrope
* [[Rikuo (darkstalkers)|]] (Aulbath in Japan) - The merman
* [[Demitri Maximoff]] - The vampire
* [[Victor Von Gerdenheim]] - The frankenstein
* [[Huitzil (darkstalkers)|]] (Phobos in Japan) - The robotic guardian sentry
* [[Bishamon (darkstalkers)|]] - The possesed samurai
* [[Sasquatch (darkstalkers)|]] - The bigfoot
* [[Pyron]] - The planet conquerer
* [[Lord Raptor]] (Zabel Zarock in Japan) - The undead rocker
* [[Jedah Dohma]] - The vampire savior cum grim reaper
* [[Mei-ling (darkstalkers)|]] (Lin-Lin in Japan) - Hsien-ko's twin and power source. She is worn as an [[ofuda]] on Hsien-ko's hat
* [[Anita (darkstalkers)|]] - Donovan's accomplice

h4. External links

[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z3 [i]Max Schultz[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z1, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

title: south_dakota_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]South Dakota[/i] (BB-57). Character design by [[Zeco]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[red hair|red]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[brown jacket]], [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]], [[black necktie]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[see-through legwear|see-through]] [[single leg pantyhose]], and [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[thighhighs]] (solid [[black thighhighs|black]] on her right, see-through on her left).

Her [[rigging]] consists of two split hull pieces containing her three 406 mm triple gun mounts and eight 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] mounts, with her real-life mainmast as a [[staff]]. 

She is oftentimes depicted with [[Kirishima (kancolle)|]], who helped cause great damage to South Dakota during the second naval battle of Guadalcanal and in turn was inflicted fatal damage from [[Washington (kancolle)|]]'s firepower. South Dakota and Washington are also depicted as not being in good terms, reflecting the great rivalry their crews had. There is an electrical switch on the left side of her gear, which can be observed more clearly on her damaged art. In her kai art, a yellow warning stripe is taped over the switch, referring to her infamous short circuit incident during the battle.

title: souya_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese auxiliary JDS [i]Souya[/i] (PL-107). Character design by [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] styled into a [[single braid]], and [[orange eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[brown shirt|brown]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a short [[pleated skirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

She takes on three different variants, corresponding to her different roles throughout her history: Her default survey ship/AGS outfit adds a [[blue coat]] over a full [[brown serafuku]] with a [[brown skirt]], and uses a [[Nambu type 14]] [[handgun]]. Her lighthouse tender/AGL form consists of a [[white coat]] over a full [[brown serafuku]] with a [[brown skirt]]. Her current icebreaker/AGB form consists of an [[orange jacket|orange]] [[hooded jacket]] over a serafuku composed of a brown shirt and a [[white skirt]]. 

She is the first Japanese and the third ever museum ship included into the game after [[Iowa_(kancolle)|]] and [[Intrepid_(kancolle)|]]. The historical ship itself is currently docked at the Museum of Maritime Science in Tokyo. This, and the several close calls the historical ship had during WWII, are translated into a maximum luck of 155 (the highest ever in the game). However, shipgirl Souya's other statistics make her practically useless in battle due to the historical ship being an auxiliary vessel (and thus, a non-combatant).

title: king_nothing
body:
King Nothing is the [[stand (jojo)|]] of [[Higashikata Norisuke IV]], featured in the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]].

King Nothing is a hollow humanoid [[Stand (jojo)|]] made entirely out of jigsaw [[puzzle piece]]s. It has two long, drooping [[horns]] and long, shield-shaped eyes. Between its horns and the piece around its neck, it takes a shape reminiscent of certain traditional depictions of a [[jester]].

Namesake is the song "King Nothing" by American rock band [[Metallica]] from their sixth studio album [i]Load[/i].

h4. External Links
* "Jojo Wiki":https://jojowiki.com/King_Nothing

title: arlan_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. The head of Herta Space Station's security department, voiced by [[Shiraishi Ryouko]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]] and with a [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[purple eyes]], and [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]]. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] worn under a [[grey jacket]], [[blue armband]] with the Herta Space Station emblem, [[bandages]] on his left arm, [[mismatched gloves|differently-colored gloves]] ([[black gloves|black]] on his right and [[white gloves|white]] on his left), [[blue pants]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

With him is a dog named [[Peppy (honkai: star rail)|]]. He resembles both [[Cyno (genshin impact)|]] and [[Razor (genshin impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #7689935: Splash art

h4. Profile

[expand]
The inarticulate head of Herta Space Station's Security Department.

While scientific research is beyond his understanding, Arlan is willing to risk his life to protect the staff who value research so very much. He is used to the pain and wears his scars like badges of honor.

Only when holding Peppy does the boy finally let down his guard and show a rare smile.
[/expand]

Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black undershirt]] worn under a [[white dress]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black jacket]], red [[hair ribbon]]s and [[cross hair ornament]]s, red [[drawstring]] with a [[tassel]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black boots]], and uses a [[sword]] as her melee weapon. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces, each with 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] and a 120 mm single gun mount, held by joints to a back piece containing her [[depth charge]]s.

title: tzeentch
body:
[[Warhammer 40k]] character. One of the four [[chaos (warhammer)|Chaos]] Gods, representing sorcery, ambition, trickery, and change. 
His form is ever-shifting, but he is typically represented as a monstrous humanoid with gangly limbs, no head, and a deformed face set in his chest. 
Alternatively, he may be drawn to resemble one of his Daemons, as a giant [[furry|anthropomorphic]] blue bird.

body:

Based off Inspector Lestrade from the [[The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes]].

title: kongou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Kongou[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]] (Japanese) and [[Alexis Tipton]] (English).

She has [[purple eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] bunched into [[double bun|two braided buns]], and an [[ahoge]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[hakama short skirt|hakama skirts]] (hers is [[black skirt|black]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]]. 

Being historically constructed in England, she has peculiar speech habits which include using random English words. Her catchphrase (from her speech when firing) is "[[Burning_love_(phrase)|Burning Love!]]" This does not keep her English from being so grammatically incorrect and accented to nearly be incomprehensible.

Her excitable dere-dere nature and frequent demands for attention from the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]] lead her to being portrayed as being "protago-sexual" in fan works, falling in love with anyone who is the protagonist of a series. Her openness and one of her lines, "Hey! Admiral! [[It's OK to touch]], but there's a time and place for everything," has earned its own tag.

She is an avid drinker of [[black tea]], sometimes to the point of being addicted to the stuff (see pool #7461).

title: polyxia_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A non-playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. The sister of [[Castorice (honkai: star rail)|]] and the current iteration of the Death Titan Thanatos. Voiced by [[Inagaki Konomi]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed much like her sister with the same [[purple hair]], but has a [[medium hair|shorter hair length]] and tends to have her eyes closed. In addition, she has the right side of her face covered.

title: bakugan
body:
A toy and anime franchise launched in 2007 that centers around the eponymous creatures known as Bakugan. They take the shape of balls that transform into beasts when thrown into battle. The story generally revolves around the Bakugan home planet known as Vestroia coming into contact with Earth and humans meeting the Bakugan. 

The original Bakugan anime ran for 4 seasons:

* [[Bakugan Battle Brawlers]] 
* [[Bakugan New Vestroia]] 
* [[Bakugan Gundalian Invaders]]
* [[Bakugan Mechtanium Surge]]

The anime was rebooted in 2018 with the first season titled; 
* [[Bakugan: Battle Planet]] 

And again in 2023, simply titled; "Bakugan".

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bakugan Battle Brawlers":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bakugan_Battle_Brawlers]

title: gundam_alc_encounter
body:
[i]Kidou Senshi Gundam ALC ENCOUNTER[/i] (機動戦士ガンダム ALC ENCOUNTER) was a 2024 promotional anime short commemorating the Lalaport expansion to the Fukuoka Mall. It was projected onto an exterior wall near the life-size Nu Gundam statue erected at the mall. 

It featured a chance encounter of Char Aznable, Amuro Ray, and a girl resembling Lalah Sune at the mall, set to the song HOT by illiomote.

title: mary_anning_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She was one of the original servants in [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]'s ""Learn Even More with Manga! FGO":[/pools/10385]". She first appeared in post #3394140. She is based on the English archaeologist, fossil collector, dealer, and paleontologist with the same name. She is portrayed as a [[yuri|lesbian]] (with a notable obsession over [[Saber (fate)|]] specifically) as a result of the 2020 film "Ammonite":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonite_(film).

The "horns" on the sides of her head are actually two [[ammonite]] shells, as highlighted in her third ascension.

She is accompanied by her [[spaniel (dog)|]], [[Tray (fate)|]]. Her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] allows her to summon familiars based on extinct lifeforms, including the [[Plesiosaur]], [[Ichthyosaur]], [[Dimorphodon]], [[Ammonite]], and "Belemnite":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belemnitida.

[b]True Name:[/b] "Mary Anning":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Anning
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Naganawa Maria]]

title: flannery_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Flannery[/b], known as [b]Asuna[/b] (アスナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

A Gym Leader with a fiery, brave personality, she can be a bit too serious and sometimes tries too hard to conduct herself properly [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Torkoal]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]]. In her [[pokemon rse|RSE]] outfit, she wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[black shirt|black]] [[cropped shirt|shirt]], [[denim]] [[jeans]] with a [[red belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. In her [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, she wears a [[red bandeau]] under a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt]] which is [[tied shirt|tied]] to bare her [[midriff]], [[green pants]] with a [[white belt]], and black shoes.

title: pentagon_jr
body:
Mexican professional wrestler, currently working for [[WWE]] under the ring name [b]Penta[/b]. Also known as [b]Penta El Zero M[/b] and previously worked for Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide, Lucha Underground, and [[All Elite Wrestling]]. He is well-known for his catchphrase [i]Cero Miedo[/i], which translates to "Zero Fear" in Spanish and originated from his lack of fear of the apparent curse of adopting the Pentagon wrestling character (his predecessors in using such character experienced bad luck later on in their careers), and his gimmick of breaking his opponent's arm. He is the older brother of WWE wrestler Rey Fenix. 

h4. Known moves

* [i]Fear Factor[/i] (Package [[Piledriver (wrestling)|]])
* The Sacrifice (Grounded Hammerlock & Inverted Armbreaker)
* Pentagon Driver (Pumphandle Half Nelson Driver)

title: tokyo_akazukin
body:
Tokyo Red Hood is about an eleven year old girl who usually just goes by the name of Akazukin (Little Red Riding Hood). She has a sick obsession with a being known only as Mr. Wolf and wants nothing more than to be eaten by him to end her "immortal" life. Akazukin has lost all of her memories and doesn't even know who she really is. Her reason to want to be eaten by Mr. Wolf is not even known to her, instead it's a desire that is locked deep within her consciousness.

The beings of the world are mainly made up of two forces. The people who aid Akazukin in her search for Mr. Wolf, and the people who try to keep Akazukin away from Mr. Wolf. The people of the church and disciples of God try to keep Akazukin from completing her mission to meet Mr. Wolf. Their reason for doing this is because if Akazukin is eaten by the Wolf, it would bring along an end to the world and humankind as it exists in the present day. The people whose origins are from the underworld aid Akazukin to find Mr. Wolf so the fate of the world being destroyed can be fulfilled. They mainly do this discreetly and behind the shadows.

Akazukin works as an organ harvester for an Italian butcher named Marco. From there she hunts new bodies for him and all the while tries to find Mr. Wolf. Along the way she meets villains who stand in her way from fulfilling her wish to be eaten by Mr. Wolf.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Red_Hood

title: male_robin_(festive_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Male robin (fire emblem)|Male Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in his winter attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2017 "Winter's Envoy":[https://feheroes.gamepedia.com/Winter's_Envoy_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: A red [[cloak]] with [[gold trim]] and a [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped pattern on the sleeves, a white [[tunic]] over a black [[undershirt]], red [[mittens]], black [[boots]], and a fake [[christmas tree]] with a [[candy cane]] for the log.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Male Robin in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red [[fur trim]] [[dress]] with a green [[christmas tree]] pattern at the end, a [[santa hat]] with. a green and black [[ribbon]] with a [[bell]], a white [[belt]] with a [[satchel]], and a large [[sack]] on her back.

May be depicted holding her weapon: a small [[christmas tree]] decorated with [[christmas ornaments]] and a [[star (symbol)|]] on top.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Nino in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: A red [[sleeveless shirt]] with [[gold trim]], a red and white [[cape]], brown [[gloves]] with white ends, a green and white [[ribbon]] across the chest with a [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped clasp, a [[santa costume|santa hat]], and a white [[sack]].

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a white [[dress]] with a red [[banner]] layered over it, a red [[cape]] with [[tassels]] that is green on the inside, a green [[headband]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] in the center, a green and yellow [[ribbon]] around her neck, and red [[gloves]]. Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red [[dress]] with a [[Christmas tree]] pattern at the end, overtop a full [[reindeer]] [[costume]], a brown [[fur trim]] [[cape]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] pattern on the inside, which is held together by a red and green [[ribbon]] and a small [[bell]], brown [[fur trim]] [[boots]] and [[gloves]], and fake [[antlers]] with fake [[reindeer]] ears.

title: mountain_tim
body:
Mountain Tim is a secondary ally featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user and is able to shift through his [[lasso]] with his ability, [[Oh! Lonesome Me (stand)|]].
Mountain Tim is a man of average to above-average height, average build and has light hair. He later acquires a [[scar]] crossing his face.

He wears a stereotypical range of cowboy attire; his hat has a [[zebra print]] with a miniature [[cow skull|cow's skull]] as a decoration, while the clothing on his upper torso is coated with a [[leopard print]], his [[belt]] gun [[holster]], and his [[scarf]] has a [[leopard print]]. He wears a sheriff's badge in the shape of a five-pointed [[star (symbol)|]] on his left side.

title: star_(symbol)
body:
A symbol representing a star. The five-pointed (★) star is the most common example, but is not the only shape.

* For stars in the night sky, see [[star (sky)]].
* For the similar symbol associated with occultism (⛤/⛧), see [[pentagram]] or [[pentacle]].

title: richard_p._leary_kai_(kancolle)
body:
The upgraded form of [[Richard P. Leary (Kancolle)|]]. Changes from her base form are her dress changing from grey color to blue, and her [[rigging]] changes from a camouflage color pattern to "Measure 22":[https://www.shipcamouflage.com/measure_22.htm] paint scheme, with red, blue, and grey color in distinct layers. 

Leary also gains two [[star (symbol)|]]s on her collar, one silver and one bronze, like her sister [[Johnston (Kancolle)|]].

title: giselle_gewelle
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

Giselle Gewelle is a [[Quincy (bleach)|]] and a member of the [[Wandenreich]]'s [[Sternritter]] with the designation "Z - The Zombie," which gives him the ability to [[zombification|zombify]] anyone who comes in contact with his blood.

Despite acting in a ditzy manner, in reality Giselle is cruel and extremely sadistic, as shown by the way he treats [spoilers][[Bambietta Basterbine]][/spoilers] after zombifying her.

Although Giselle is often referred to as a girl, he is a biological male (and should be tagged as such).

title: honobono_log
body:
Made by "Fanworks":[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanworks_(animation_studio)], and directed by Kiki Matsui, Honobono Log is a short, 10 episode anime based on Naka Fukamachi's illustrated book published in 2014, with the same name, "Honobono Log".

Some of us are fortunate enough to have a partner to confide in on our bad days. In even the most devastating times, we can depend on our comrades for support. Others are incredibly lucky to have a special someone that they can just randomly embrace. No matter the situation, there always tends to be a close ally to help us get by.

h4. Characters
* [[Chiharu (honobono_log)]] - Main Character
* [[Eita (honobono_log)]] - Main Character
* [[Natsumi (honobono_log)]] - Supporting Character

title: breasts_on_head
body:
A fairly common trope in anime pictures involving a shorter character standing underneath a taller (and more endowed) character, with the head of the shorter pushing into the [[cleavage]] of the taller from beneath.

Also applies to any angle, so long as the breasts are being rested on the head of another character.

Often implies a significant degree of [[height difference]].

This tag does not include the [[breast_smother|face-between-breasts]] position.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Breasts Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]
other_names: 膝枕幸せサンドイッチ

title: lap_pillow
body:
When someone's head is resting in someone else's lap.

If a character is merely inviting someone to rest on their lap, use [[lap pillow invitation]] instead. If the body rather than the head is resting on the lap, use [[lying on lap]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[breast pillow]]
* [[pectoral pillow]]
* [[ear cleaning]]
* [[lap pillow invitation]]
* [[lap pov]]

title: takashi_shirogane
body:
[i][[Voltron: Legendary Defender]][/i] character. Mainly known by his nickname "Shiro".

A young man that suddenly returns to Earth after being captured by the Galra on an expedition a year prior to the main story. Takes the name and physical appearance of the [i]Golion[/i] former [[Ao-jishi]] pilot [[Shirogane Takashi]], but takes the place of [[Kogane Akira]] as the [[Kuro-jishi (golion)|]] pilot and [spoiler]initial[/spoiler] leader of Voltron/Golion. Has Galra tech as a [[amputee|replacement arm]].

h4. See also

* [[Sven (Voltron)|]] (alternate universe version)
* [[Curtis (Voltron)|]]

title: sven_(voltron)
body:
[i][[Voltron: Legendary Defender]][/i] character.

An alternate universe version of [[Takashi Shirogane]] that is forming a small resistance against his universe's Alteans with [[Slav (voltron)|]]. His name, personality, and appearance are based on Sven Holgersson from [i]Voltron: Defender of the Universe[/i], and through that, based on [[Shirogane Takashi]] from [i]GoLion[/i] in appearance.

title: kou_uraki
body:
A fictional main character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

[b]Kou Uraki[/b] is a young [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[mobile suit|MS]] test [[pilot]] [spoiler]involved in the tragic events that led to the creation of the [[Titans (gundam)|]][/spoiler].

His mecha of choice are the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]], the [[Gundam GP-01 Full Vernian Zephyranthes]] and the [[Gundam GP-03 Stamen]].

title: baek_yoon-ho

title: hongou_takeshi
body: The first protagonist of the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise, serving as [[Kamen Rider 1]] in [[Kamen Rider (1st series)|]]. Played by [[Fujioka Hiroshi]], who would later go on to play [[Segata Sanshirou]]. In [[Shin Kamen Rider]], he would be played by Sosuke Ikematsu.

title: segata_sanshirou
body:
A fictional character created by [[Sega]] to advertise the [[Sega Saturn]] in Japan between 1997 and 1998. He is a parody of Sugata Sanshirō, a legendary [[judo]] fighter from an [[kurosawa akira|Akira Kurosawa]] film.

Sanshiro is a dan holder for multiple Japanese martial arts (karate and iaidou first dan, judo third dan, battoudou fourth dan, toudou 7th dan, etc). He is portrayed by actor [[Fujioka Hiroshi]], who, until that point, was best known for playing the hero [[Hongou Takeshi]] in the influential tokusatsu superhero series [[Kamen Rider]].

For Sega's 60th anniversary, in late March 2020, a new mascot was revealed, one who was Segata's son, called Sega Shirō (せが四郎), actually played by Fujioka Hiroshi's eldest son, Fujioka Maito.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Segata Sanshiro":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Segata_Sanshiro

title: delta_gundam_kai
body:
[b]MSN-001X Gundam Delta Kai[/b]

Prototype transformable [[mobile suit]] developed from the [[Delta Plus]] as a technology demonstrator. Contains the NITRO system, allowing non-Newtypes to use the pair of prototype [[Fin Funnels]] equipped on the machine. Its frame has been enhanced with extra thrusters, allowing it to fly both in space and in the atmosphere.

Armed with a shield that doubles as the Delta Kai's forward section in Waverider Mode; the shield also carries a pair of beam sabers that double as beam guns when transformed and a mounting section for a variety of experimental weapons.

A hand-held beam cannon called a "Long Mega Buster" rounds out its weapon loadout.

This suit appears in Mobile Suit [[Gundam Unicorn]]: UC 0094 - Across the Sky, the Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn video game and UC: MSV.

[b]NOTE:[/b] The HGUC kit contains extra parts from the Delta Plus mold, such as an extra Beam Rifle.

title: garaho_flip_phone
body:
A type of Japanese [[Android (os)|]] [[smartphone]] that resembles a feature phone, being able to be folded like a [[flip phone]]. They are typically larger and more rectangular than Western flip phones, and often feature a LED display on the outside that shows the date and time.

They are commonly made by AQUOS and Sharp.

Consider tagging [[smartphone]] as well if you can clearly see the smartphone interface, or if the phone has a touchscreen that covers both sides (post #8337427).

A string or loop that is used to help the user hold their cellphone.

In Japan this simple strap turned into a decorative accessory called a "keitai strap" (携帯ストラップ). Various characters such as [[Hello Kitty]] - for example - hang from them, or the cellphone itself.

h4. See also

* [[cellphone]]
* [[charm (object)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Phone strap":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phone_strap]

title: apex_legends
body:
Free-to-play battle-royale game released by [[Respawn Entertainment]] in February 2019 for [[Xbox One]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[computer|PC]], with a [[Nintendo Switch]] port in 2021 and an upgraded version for [[Xbox Series X]] and [[PlayStation 5]] in 2022. A [[apex legends mobile|smartphone port]] developed in collaboration with Tencent's LightSpeed Studios was released in 2022, though it ultimately shut down in 2023. The port was treated as a separate game entirely and featured exclusive cosmetics and legends.

It quickly gained mass popularity, rivaling contemporaries such as [[Overwatch]], [[Playerunknown's Battlegrounds|PUBG]] & [[Fortnite]] in player & streaming view count. The game is notably very popular in Japan, where first-person shooters typically have difficulty finding a large following. It is the favorite game of many [[virtual YouTuber]]s and eSports players, with both [[Hololive]]/[[Holostars]] and [[Nijisanji]] having several talents who dedicate most of their stream time to playing it.

Despite not featuring the parkour and mecha elements of the main series, Apex Legends is considered a canon part of the [[Titanfall (series)|]] franchise. Due to how it's largely treated as a separate entity with its own spin-offs, the Titanfall series tag should not be added to Apex posts unless there's a direct reference beyond the shared weapons.

title: browning_m1917
body:
The [b]Browning M1917[/b] is a [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] water-cooled heavy [[machine gun]] invented by [[John Moses Browning]] to equip the United States Military upon their entry into [[World War I]]. Despite looking similar to many [[Maxim gun]]s such as the British [[Vickers Machine Gun]] or the German [[MG08]], the M1917 shares no similarity with the Maxim design other than also functioning via blowback operation, and thus cannot be called a "Maxim gun". 

Despite being ostensibly replaced by later designs such as the [[Browning M1919]], the M1917's excellence in sustained-fire (laying down long bursts of continuous shooting, infamous for making any machine gun very hot) meant that it continued to see frontline use during [[World War II]] and the [[Korean War]]. 


h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia:M1917 Browning Machine Gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1917_Browning_machine_gun

title: racing_miku
body:
An alternate version of [[Hatsune Miku]] that serves as the mascot for [[GoodSmile Racing]].

[[Hatsune Miku]] receives a new design in a [[race queen]] theme for each racing season since 2009. The designs are officially acknowledged as "Racing Miku" (レーシングミク). The real life race queens for GoodSmile are known as the "Racing Miku Supporters" and wear outfits based on the Racing Miku design of the year.

The 2009 derivative is the only version of the Racing Miku derivatives which did not have an official illustration as per her release, though it was featured in merchandise for that season and new official arts have been given later on. The unveiling of the Racing Miku derivatives only became a feature from the 2010 season onwards. All merchandise related to Good Smile Racing featuring Miku prior to the 2010 season, with the exception of the 2009 Racing Miku figurine, features Miku in her normal attire.

title: shin_sakura_taisen
body:
A reboot of the [[Sakura Taisen]] franchise, known simply as [i]Project Sakura Wars[/i] during development, and released for [[PlayStation 4]] on December 12, 2019. The game is set 12 years after [[Sakura Taisen V]], and features an entirely new main cast, as well as real time action gameplay instead of the series' usual turn-based strategy gameplay. An anime series set shortly after the game's events began airing on April 3, 2020.

The game was released overseas on April 28, 2020. Due to the fact that the majority of the franchise had never been released outside of Japan, it was renamed to simply [i][b]Sakura Wars[/b][/i] in foreign markets.

[[Kubo Tite]] is the official character designer for the main cast, with guest artists providing designs for supporting characters.

Human paramour of [[hawk (mechanical buddy universe)|Hawk]], and granddaughter to the [[Parts Shop Geezer_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

She is given the name "Riika Rikkinen" (リーカ・リッキネン) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: hawk_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A model TGP11S automated sentry gun armed with a sniper machine gun. Holds and reloads the machine gun 'manually' with mechanical arms, unlike most robotic sentry guns with integrated weapons.

It is given the nickname "Hawk" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".
other_names: TGP11S自律型狙撃機銃『ホークアイ』

title: letterboxed
body:
An image technique where bars are displayed at the bottom and top of a picture.
Letterboxed does not count as a border but [[outside border]] may be used with it.

See [[pillarboxed]] for when an image has bars on the left and right sides.

title: after-school_sweets_club_(blue_archive)
body:
After-School Sweets Club is one of the clubs at Trinity General School in [[Blue Archive]].

The club's goal is to find and eat any notable or popular sweets and desserts. They're considered the opposite of the [[Gourmet research society (blue archive)|Gourmet Research Society]], as unlike their Gehenna counterparts, the Sweets Club do not destroy restaurants and food stalls they dislike.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

While [[Reisa (blue archive)|Uzawa Reisa]] often appears with the group, she is not a part of the club.

h4. Members

* [[Yoshimi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Airi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Kazusa (blue archive)|]]
* [[Natsu (blue archive)|]]

title: fiji_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Fiji[/i] (58). Character design by [[Yuran]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit (shared with her sisters) consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]], [[red choker]], [[red skirt]], [[white belt]], [[white panties|white]] [[highleg panties]], [[black thighhighs]], [[grey boots|grey]] [[knee boots]], and [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with her 152 mm triple gun mounts, two per side and with [[anchor]] [[chain]]s. 

Historically named after the Pacific country of the same name (under British rule as a colony), her class was essentially a scaled down version of the preceding Town-class light cruisers (specifically, the [[Edinburgh (Azur Lane)|]] design) to conform with the lower 8,000 ton displacement limit for cruisers under the Second London Treaty (as opposed to 10,000 tons in the previous Washington and First London Treaties).

h4. Skins
* !post #3033382: Default
* !post #3536338: [[fiji (trendy and vogue?) (azur lane)|Trendy and Vogue?]]

h4. [i]Fiji[/i]-class light cruisers

* [b]Fiji[/b] (58)
* [[Jamaica (Azur Lane)|]] (44)
* [[Trinidad (azur lane)|]] (46)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Fiji[/i] (58)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Fiji_(58)]
other_names: フィジー(アズールレーン)

title: ryuujou_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Ryuujou[/i]. Character design by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

Her base art portrays her with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], [[dragon horns]], [[dragon tail]], and [[green eyes]], in line with her name (meaning "prancing dragon"). Her outfit consists of a white [[midriff]] with [[white sailor collar]], a white [[military uniform]] coat with traditional [[long sleeves]], a red [[hakama short skirt]], [[rudder footwear]], and dragon scales-themed [[socks]]. Her rig consists of her real-life [[flight deck]] to her right and her bridge and three bow pieces on her left.

title: shaved_ice
body:
A Japanese [[dessert]] consisting of shaved ice in a cup, flavored with syrup and a sweetener (often condensed milk), and eaten with a spoon.

Japanese shaved ice stands usually have a flag with the kanji "ice" on it called [[kooribata]].

Shaved ice with [[matcha (food)|]] syrup is called [[ujikintoki]].

h4.See also

* [[ice shaver]]
* [[kooribata]] 
* [[shirokuma (food)]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kakigōri":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kakigori

title: jamaica_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Jamaica[/i] (44). Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]]. 

She is portrayed with [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]], [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt]] with a [[white belt]], [[white gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with her real-life 152 mm triple gun mounts, two per side, and an [[anchor]] [[chain]] connected to her left wrist with [[cuffs]]. 

She historically saw service escorting [[Duke of York (Azur Lane)|]] in the battle of North Cape and [[Victorious (Azur Lane)|]] in carrier airstrikes against [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]], and is reflected in her debut event: "Winter's Crown".

title: ice_cream_cup
body:
A [[cup]] used to serve [[ice cream]]. In [[restaurant]]s, they're usually made out of glass, typically short, footed with a wide bowl. For convenience stores and ice cream parlors, they're designed for eating on the go, made out of [[disposable cup|disposable]] paper and may have an [[ice cream spoon]] attached to the cup.

Do not confused with [[parfait glass]] which is typically much taller and with narrower rim.

h4. Examples
* !post #2184535: glass
* !post #6486937: metal (right) with [[parfait glass]] (left)
* !post #9274978: disposable

h4.See also

* [[Haagen-Dazs]]
* [[cone holder]]
* [[ice cream spoon]]

title: drinking_glass
body:
Any type of glass [[cup]] made for drinking cold beverages. Using one to drink a hot beverage is not recommended as it could break, unless the glass is thick.

h4. Types

h5. footed glasses

* !post #8530852: [[cocktail glass]] (long stem, conical bowl)
* !post #8199893: [[champagne coupe]] (long stem, wide shallow round bowl)
* !post #8072231: [[margarita glass]] (long stem, upside-down-sombrero-like bowl)
* !post #7611208: [[nick and nora glass]] (long stem, small, round bowl)
* !post #4237968: [[goblet glass]] (short stem, wide bowl, straight-sided)
* !post #8592630: [[snifter glass]] ([i]right[/I]) (short stem, wide bowl, narrow top)
* !post #8035122: [[wine glass]] (long stem, wide round bowl, narrow top)
* !post #7598009: [[poco grande glass]] (short, wide vase-shaped bowl)
* !post #8545421: [[hurricane glass]] (tall, narrow vase-shaped bowl)
* !post #8018239: [[champagne flute]] (long stem, tall narrow bowl)

h5. Tumbler glasses

* !post #8161263: [[tumbler glass]] (cylindrical-like, flat-bottomed, no stem nor handle, [i]only used when unidentifiable[/i])
* !post #8444681: [[faceted glass]] (type of tumbler glass, multi-sided)
* !post #8091121: [[highball glass]] (type of tumbler glass, tall, straight-sided)
* !post #8128916: [[rocks glass]] (type of tumbler glass, short, thick base, wide rim)
* !post #6469969: [[shot glass]] (type of tumbler glass, small)

h4.See also

* [[Alcohol]]
* [[Holding cup]]
* [[Holding drink]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: parfait_glass
body:
A type of [[drinking glass]] used to serve [[parfait]], typically a tall stemware with wide and usually wavy rim. Variants with no or indistinct stem also exist.

Do not confused with [[ice cream cup]], which is typically shorter and wider, and [[milkshake glass]], which is fluted.

h4. Example
* !post #1055526: with stem
* !post #2881690: indistinct stem
* !post #2394331: no stem

body:

The only Saber-class Servant summoned during the Holy Grail War in [[Fate/Strange Fake]]. His True Name is [b]Richard I[/b], the King of England from 1189 until 1199. * Two characters from a named series known to be mother and daughter.

h4. See also

title: lego_dimensions
body:
A 2015 [[toy]]s-to-life action-adventure [[video game]] that brought together a multitude of popular franchises in a [[LEGO]]-themed [[crossover]].

Across two years of add-ons, the game pulled in 30-plus franchises, from [[DC Comics]], [[The Lord of the Rings]] and [[Doctor Who]] to [[The Simpsons]], [[Portal (series)|Portal]], [[Harry Potter (series)|Harry Potter]], [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]], [[Adventure Time]], [[The A-Team]], [[Beetlejuice]] and many more.
other_names: レゴディメンションズ

title: lego_sonic
body:
The brick-built counterpart of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] who comes from the [[LEGO]] multiverse introduced in the [[LEGO Dimensions]] “[[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] Level Pack”, where he pursues [[Dr. Eggman]] across realities with the help of a stolen Keystone Device.

Shaped as a blue minifigure that drops and collects gold studs in place of [[Ring (Sonic)|Rings]], he keeps all of Sonic’s trademark speed, Spin Dash and wisecracks while being cheerfully aware he’s made of plastic. The variant later slips into other continuities—most visibly as a free “switch Sonic into his LEGO form” skin in [i][[Sonic Superstars]][/i]—but he remains, at heart, the same thrill-seeking hero from a world built entirely out of ABS bricks.

title: selettrice_vaalmonica
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 4
[b]Attribute:[/b] Water
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster / Effect
[i]While you control a monster, except "Selettrice Vaalmonica", your opponent's monsters cannot target this card for attacks. You can only use each of the following effects of "Selettrice Vaalmonica" once per turn. If this card is Normal or Pendulum Summoned: You can add 1 "Vaalmonica" card from your Deck to your hand, except "Selettrice Vaalmonica". If this card is sent to the GY and you have 2 "Vaalmonica" cards in your Pendulum Zones: You can add this card to your hand.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 1200
[b]DEF:[/b] 1200

title: castlevania:_dracula_x_chronicles
body: Castlevania: The Dracula X Chronicles is a 2007 action-platform game developed and published by [[Konami]] for the [[PlayStation Portable]]. The game is a remake of [[Castlevania: Rondo of Blood]] (1993) with 2.5D graphics, and represents the first time that Rondo of Blood was released outside of Japan. The game includes the original Rondo of Blood localized into English, as well as a remastered version of [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]] (1997). The game was released in North America on October 23, 2007.

title: the_masculine_urge_to_slowly_bleed_out_here_(meme)
body:
[b]The Masculine Urge to Slowly Bleed Out Here[/b] is a catchphrase used in a series of [[the Masculine urge (meme)|Masculine Urge memes]] in which people long after slowly succumbing to their injuries in a peaceful location that offers solitude, such as an empty snowy riverwalk. The memes reference and glamorize the fates of various film and video game characters, most notably [[k (blade runner 2049)|Officer K]] dying on snow-covered stairs in the 2017 film [[Blade Runner 2049]].

The meme references a media trope of male protagonists succumbing to their injuries in solitude in a peaceful location. Officer K's death as he lay dying on snow-covered steps in the 2017 film Blade Runner 2049 is "one popular example":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dzk3w5cLxnI]. Other notable examples include [[Spike Spiegel|Spike Spiegel's]] ambiguous fate in the 1998 anime series [[Cowboy Bebop]] in which he collapses on stairs, and the 2018 video game [[Detroit: Become Human]] in which one possible end of a character plotline can be them dying on a snowy riverwalk.

h4. See also
* [[The Masculine Urge (meme)]]

title: vanguard_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Vanguard[/i] (23). Character design by [[Ask (askzy)|]], voiced by [[Nakashima Yuki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[white cape]] with green inside color, white [[thighhighs]], [[black footwear]], black [[hair ribbon]], and [[black gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] is a large and elaborate setup akin to the French factions, sporting her four historical 381 mm twin gun mounts and two 13.3 cm twin DP secondary mounts.

From her voice lines, she is implied to be an [[otaku]], made more apparent with "her gacha build obtain animation":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=smcvah3Sqp8] that resembles a [i]mahou shoujo[/i] transformation sequence. 

In real life, [i]Vanguard[/i] was the Royal Navy's largest and fastest battleship (45,000 tons and 30 knots), but was the last British battleship built and commissioned. She was built to a modified [i]Lion[/i]-class design meant to take in Courageous' and [[Glorious (Azur Lane)|]]' original 381 mm guns in storage to expedite construction. She was launched in 1944, commissioned in 1946, and sold for scrap in 1960.



h4. Skins

* !post #6008198: Default
* !post #5383063: [[Vanguard (Half-Hearted Masquerade) (Azur Lane)|Half-Hearted Masquerade]]

* [[Vanguard (Warship Girls R)]]

title: mouth_guard
body: A mouth guard is a shaped piece of plastic or rubber used to protect the teeth and gums from injury during contact sports activity, such as [[ice hockey|hockey]] or [[American football]]. Another kind of mouth guard, also called a sleep guard or bite guard, is used while sleeping to prevent the grinding of teeth or for other kinds of dental and orthodontic treatment. A mouth guard is worn inside the mouth, between the teeth, and so may only be visible when it is taken out, or the character's mouth is sufficiently [[open mouth|open]].

title: mouthpiece
body:
The portion of a musical [[instrument]] that comes in contact with the player's mouth. Use this tag if the mouthpiece is depicted on its own (post #2038640) or is otherwise prominent in the image.

For protective devices used to prevent injury to the wearer's teeth, see [[mouth guard]]. For hands-free communication devices, see [[headset]].

title: harmonica
body:
The [b]harmonica[/b], also [b]French harp[/b], [b]blues harp[/b], and [b]mouth organ[/b], is a free reed wind [[instrument]] used worldwide in nearly every musical genre, notably in blues, American folk music, jazz, country, and rock and roll. There are many types of harmonica, including diatonic, chromatic, tremolo, octave, orchestral, and bass versions. A harmonica is played by using the mouth (lips and/or tongue) to direct air into and out of one or more holes along a [[mouthpiece]].

h4. See also

* [[Instrument]]
* [[Music]]
* [[Glass Harmonica]]
* [[Harp]]
* [[Organ (instrument)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonica

title: glass_harmonica
body:
The [b]glass harmonica[/b], also known as the [b]glass armonica[/b], [b]bowl organ[/b], [b]hydrocrystalophone[/b], or simply the [b]armonica[/b] (derived from αρμονία ("harmonia"), the Greek word for harmony), is a type of musical [[instrument]] that uses a series of glass bowls or goblets graduated in size to produce musical tones by means of friction (instruments of this type are known as [i]friction idiophones[/i]).

h4. See also

* [[Instrument]]
* [[Music]]
* [[Harmonica]]
* [[Organ (instrument)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "[i]Wikipedia[/i] article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glass_harmonica

title: bill_cosby
body:
[b]Bill Cosby[/b] (born July 12, 1937) was a former comedian and actor. As one of many African-American actors who gain fame and acceptance during the 1960s, he was known as "America's Dad" due to his fatherly image thanks to his hit sitcom, The Cosby Show and commercials he has appeared.

However, since 2014, his reputation has diminished in the public after allegations of drug rape, sexual assault and harassment with several women that span decades throughout his career.

title: dr._two-brains
body:
The villainous alter-ego of Professor [[Steven Boxleitner]], a once-kind but easily distracted [[scientist]]. During an experiment intended to let humans read rodent thoughts, Boxleitner’s mind was accidentally merged with that of a malicious lab [[mouse]] named [[Squeaky (WordGirl)|Squeaky]]. The fusion leaves him literally with “two [[brain]]s” (one human, one mouse), turning him into a [[cheese]]-obsessed super-criminal and one of the chief antagonists of the [[WordGirl (series)|WordGirl series]].

h4. External links
* "WordGirl Wiki":https://wordgirl.fandom.com/wiki/Dr._Two-Brains

title: dissolving
body:
When a character or object becomes incorporated into a [[liquid]], or turns to [[smoke]]. 

* Use [[fading]] if the character is becoming transparent.
* Use [[melting]] instead if a character or object is [[dripping]].
* Use [[disintegration]] instead if the character is breaking into [[shards]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7668627
* !post #6099494

h4. See also

* [[digital dissolve]]
* [[dissolving clothes]]
* [[disintegration]]
* [[melting]]
* [[merging bodies]]

title: slap_of_god_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] based on redraws of a scene from the 2017 film [[Mom and Dad (2017 movie)|]], where [[Nicolas Cage]]'s character has his son pinned to the floor and slams him into the ground with his palm. Also referred to as [b]Morty I'm Bored, I'm Gonna Kill You[/b], after a line from a version of the meme with [[Rick Sanchez]] and [[Morty Smith]].

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Slap of God/I'm Bored I'm Gonna Kill You":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/slap-of-god-im-bored-im-gonna-kill-you]

title: heal_unit_(sonic)
body:
Life-saving devices that appear in the game [i][[Shadow the Hedgehog (game)|Shadow the Hedgehog]][/i]. They are large mechanical capsules that can be thrown and exploded. When they burst, they release a blue energy that can heal humans, robots, and even the alien Black Arms race.

h4. External links
* "Sonic Wiki Zone":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Heal_Unit

title: goal_balloon_(sonic)
body:
A gameplay objective featured in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], specifically serving as the finish marker for [[Amy Rose]]'s Action Stages in [[Sonic Adventure]].

Goal Balloons are large yellow [[balloon]]s decorated with blue circles, each marked with a red five-pointed [[star (symbol)|star]]. A distinct red ring hangs from a rope beneath the balloon. They are typically found floating stationary in mid-air until Amy interacts with them.

h4. External links
* "Sonic Wiki Zone":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Goal_Balloon

title: marvelous_queen
body:
[[Fang the Sniper]]’s signature ride in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]: a yellow-and-blue flying “air-bike” that doubles as a hover-car in racing games and a multi-purpose gunship everywhere else. It’s essentially the weasel thief’s answer to [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]]’s natural speed—he keeps tinkering with it so he can chase Emeralds, outrun pursuers, and dish out trouble.

h4. External links
* "Sonic Wiki Zone":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Marvelous_Queen

title: winged_helmet
body:
A helmet that is adorned with wings on both sides. It's seen in ancient depictions of the greek god Mercury. however in the 19th century, the winged helmet became widely used to depict Vikings and Norse gods.

title: dimension_mirror
body:
A powerful artifact from the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It is a golden-framed [[mirror]] that serves as a portal to the Mirror World, the setting of [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]]. In that game, the mirror is shattered by [[Dark Meta Knight]], leading a team of four [[Kirby]]s to recover its pieces and face off against [[Dark Mind]].

Before the events of [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]], [[Taranza]] obtained this mirror and gifted it to [[Queen Sectonia]], eventually leading to her corruption.

h4. External links

* "WiKirby: Dimension Mirror":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Dimension_Mirror
other_names: ディメンションミラー

title: shadow_kirby
body:
A dark counterpart to [[Kirby]], making his debut in [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]] as a shady character who ends up being a valuable ally to the young hero.

He has made numerous cameos and side appearances since then, sometimes even sparring with Kirby like in the [[kirby fighters 2|Kirby Fighters]] games. In these games, however, he sports white eyes and a purple, void-like body, as opposed to his usual grey color scheme.

h4. External links

* "WiKirby: Shadow Kirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Shadow_Kirby

title: galaxia_(sword)
body:
[[Meta Knight]]'s trademark [[sword]] in the [[Kirby (series)|]] video game series, also appearing in the anime [[Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]] and the [[Super Smash Bros.]] games. It has a golden blade with 4-6 spikes (2-3 on each side) and a ruby-colored pommel stone on its hilt.

In the games, Meta Knight is capable of summoning tornadoes and sword beams with it, but in the anime adaptation, it is a separate entity with a mind of its own. As a sentient being, Galaxia will only allow those with pure intentions to touch it; otherwise, they will be electrocuted and/or killed. The only known character besides Meta Knight that is capable of wielding Galaxia is [[Kirby]].

In [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]], Meta Knight wields a sword called the Master, or the Master Sword. It reuses the appearance of the Galaxia in Meta Knight's sprites and [[official art]], though in other artwork its appearance varies. It is unconfirmed whether or not these are the same sword, or if "Master" is merely the name of the [[copy ability]] Kirby gains while wielding it.

[spoilers][[Magolor Soul]] and [[Void Termina]] can use giant swords closely resembling Galaxia in their boss fights, which raises more questions than answers.[/spoilers]

title: magic_kirby
body:

In this form, Kirby wears a [[black hat|black]] [[top hat]].

title: three_quarter_profile
body:
Almost a [[profile]] shot, but a portion of the character's other eye and/or brow is distinctly visible.

This is an incredibly ubiquious way of drawing a character in art. Due to its ubiquity, to see this kind of post you can just open "the main page":/posts.

h4. Examples

* !post #7812437
* !post #5163973

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Three-quarter view":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portrait_painting#three-quarter_view

title: cupid_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]] and [[Kirby: Squeak Squad]] that turns [[Kirby]] into an [[angel]] that can use a [[bow (weapon)|bow and arrow]] and [[flying|fly]].

In this form, Kirby gains a [[halo]] and a pair of [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]].

[[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]] refers to it as Angel Kirby, its Japanese name.

title: missile_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]] and [[Kirby: Canvas Curse]] which lets [[Kirby]] turn into a [[missile]].

In this form's default state, Kirby wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[hat]] that resembles the tip of a [[missile]].

title: mini_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby & the Amazing Mirror]] which shrinks [[Kirby]] down into a minimized form.

title: three_quarter_view
body:

body:

The character should be facing to the "side" relative to their body, that is, [[turning head|turning their head]] without turning their body. If the entire body is facing to the "side" relative to the camera, use [[from side]] instead.

title: transformer
body:
A device for changing the voltage of [[electricity]].  

This tag is most commonly used to tag distribution transformers, the large cylinders seen on a power and [[utility pole]] to step-down high voltage used in transmission over long distances to the voltage used by the end customer.  It can also be used to tag pad-mount transformers on the ground or other kinds of transformers (e.g. in a detailed image of a [[circuit board]] or other electronics).

Not to be confused with the [[Transformers]], a series about transforming robots.

h4.  See also

* [[power lines]]
* [[utility pole]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Distribution transformer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distribution_transformer

title: nefertari_vivi
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The princess of Alabasta, daughter of [[Nefertari Cobra|King Cobra]] and Nefertari Titi and honorary [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hat]].

Together with [[Igaram]], she infiltrated [[Crocodile (one Piece)|Sir Crocodile's]] [[Baroque Works]], using the code name Miss Wednesday.

Occasionally seen with her pet bird and trusty steed, [[Karoo (one piece)|]].

[spoiler]She's a descendant of [[Nefertari D. Lily]], making her full name Nefertari D. Vivi and, along with the rest of her family, carriers of the legendary "Will of the D."[/spoiler]

title: bowtie
body:
A [[bow]] that is tied to the neck. Often seen on school uniforms (usually for females).

A more [[traditional_bowtie|traditional]] style is commonly seen in formal male clothing such as a [[tuxedo]], and in [[playboy bunny]] outfits (usually attached to a [[detached collar]]).

Not to be confused with a [[neck ribbon]] which lacks the volume of the [[bowtie]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4290824: Bowtie with loose ends
* !post #5638657: Bowtie without loose ends
* !asset #25361475: Bowties resemble a butterfly or two triangles

h4. Non examples

* !post #7700874: [[Neck ribbon]]. Looks thinner than a bowtie. Often with a japanese bow knot
* !post #8567560: [[Ribbon choker]]. Wraps tightly around the neck and has direct contact with the skin
* !post #9299612: [[Bow choker]]
* !post #4867149: [[Neckerchief]]. A piece of cloth resembling a necktie, there is no bow.

h4. Colors
* [[aqua bowtie]]

title: tonarino_(kyata_ti666)
body:
Also known as: Neighbor-chan, Poor-chan

[[Seina_(kyata_ti666)|]]'s next door neighbor stuck in a perpetual state of [[poverty]]. How she is able to afford an apartment without being able to pay for rent, let alone food, is a mystery. Her name is a pun of the phrase "Tonari no shibafu ha aoi" 隣の芝生は青い (The grass is greener on the other side).

title: toriyama_akira
body:
[b]Akira Toriyama[/b] (April 5, 1955 - March 1, 2024), mangaka, famous for the [i][[Dragon Ball]][/i] and [i][[Dr. Slump]][/i] manga. Worked on the character design for [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i], [i][[Chrono Trigger]][/i], [i][[Blue Dragon]][/i], [i][[Tobal no. 1]][/i], and [i][[Sand Land]][/i] series.

He passed away on March 1, 2024 at the age of 68 due to an acute subdural hematoma.

h4. See also

* [[Toriyama Akira (character)]] - for his [[artist self-insert|self-insert]]
* [[Toriyama Akira (style)]]

title: sand_land
body:
Manga by [[Toriyama Akira]], serialized in the year 2000. It follows the story of [[Beelzebub (sand land)|]], who works with the local sheriff to search for a new water supply for the citizens of Sand Land.

In December 2022, the Sand Land Project was announced, consisting of both a CGI anime adaptation co-produced by Sunrise, Kamikaze Douga and Anima, and an action RPG game developed by ILCA and published by Bandai Namco. The anime adaptation first released as a movie in August 2023, before later getting extended in the form of a TV series in Spring 2024, while the game would be released around the same time as the end of the series. The anime and the game each extend past the events of the original manga (and movie), now referred to as the "Akuma no Ouji" arc, with the "Tenshi no Yuusha" arc, also written by Toriyama.

This particular Ascension is also seen in the [b]Welcome to ONILAND![/b] [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] (post #3298239).

In [[Fate/Grand Carnival]], this Ascension is humorously paired with [[shuten douji (halloween caster) (fate)|Shuten Douji Halloween Caster]] due to them both looking like magical girls, leading them to make an obvious [[Futari wa Precure]] reference.

title: yu-gi-oh!
body:
[b]Yu-Gi-Oh![/b] (lit. [b]"King of Games"[/b]) is a manga series and media franchise originally created by [[Takahashi Kazuki]] primarily involving the [i][[Duel Monster]]s[/i] card game. The series made its first debut in 1996 on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]].

It spawned anime, video games, and [[Duel Monster|a real-life version of said card game]] produced by [[Konami]].

title: poitier_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Arya Poitier[/b] is a NPC from [[Reverse:1999]]. First introduced in the "[I]Showdown in Chinatown [/I]" event, she is a [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] officer of the Division of Arcane Affairs, whose assigned as [[Liang Yue (reverse:1999)|]] partner and mentor due to the latter's age and inexperienced. While initial seeing her assignment with Liang Yue as babysitting a rookie, Poitier later forms a friendship with her new partner, solve the strange events happening in Chinatown and discover who the vigilante "Nightpiercer" is.

Since her introduction, Poitier has been well received by fans, especially from the global side, due to being an attractive [[dark-skinned female|black woman]] and praising the makers of Reverse 1999 for creating a well written and black character, especially amongst other Chinese gacha games who were criticized by global fans for their lack of colored characters in their games. Her surname is a Shout out to the late Hollywood Actor, [b]Sidney Poitier[/b]. 

Poitier is voiced by Shannon Hemmings in English.

title: titanfall
body:
The first game in the [[Titanfall (series)|]] series, released for [[computer|PC]] and [[Xbox One]] on March 11, 2014 and later ported to [[Xbox 360]] on April 8. Often retroactively known as Titanfall 1. The game does not feature a traditional campaign, instead, the story is told through multiplayer matches with short cutscenes at the beginning and end, as well as relevant dialogue from major characters during the matches.

Respawn Entertainment removed the game from online storefronts on Xbox, Steam, and Origin in December 2021, and announced that the game would be removed from subscription services (Xbox Game Pass and EA Play) on March 1, 2022. The game's servers will remain online for owners of the game.

This tag is for the original 2014 game only. For the series as a whole, see [[Titanfall (series)]].

h4. Characters

* [[Cheng Lorck]]
* [[Kuben Blisk]]
* [[Sarah Briggs]]
* [[Spyglass (Titanfall)|]]
* [[Wilson (titanfall)|]]

h4. Titans

* [[Atlas (Titanfall)|]]
* [[Ogre (Titanfall)|]]
* [[Stryder (Titanfall)|]]

title: titanfall_2
body:
The second game in the [[Titanfall (series)|]] series, released in 2016 for [[Xbox One]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[computer|PC]]. Unlike it's predecessor, Titanfall 2 features a full single-player campaign.

h1. Characters

* [[Ash (titanfall 2)|]]

* [[Slone (titanfall 2)|]]
* [[Gates (titanfall 2)|]]
* [[Sarah Briggs]]
* [[Elias Marder]]

h1. Multiplayer [[Pilot (titanfall 2)|]] Classes

title: crypters_(fate/grand_order)
body:
Major antagonists in the second arc of [[Fate/Grand Order]], looking to supplant proper human history with their Lostbelts. Previously members of Chaldea's A-Team, who were killed during the inciting incident of the first arc and subsequently revived by the Alien God. This tag applies if [b]at least three[/b] are present in an image.

The seven Crypters are:
* [[Kadoc Zemlupus]], supervising the [[Anastasia (lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Russian Lostbelt]] with his servant [[Anastasia (fate)|]]
* [[Ophelia Phamrsolone]], supervising the [[Gotterdammerung (fate/grand order)|Scandinavian Lostbelt]] with her servant [spoiler][[Surtr (fate)|]][/spoiler]
* [[Akuta Hinako]], supervising the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|Chinese Lostbelt]] with her servant [spoiler][[Prince of Lan Ling (fate)|]][/spoiler]
* [[Scandinavia Peperoncino]], supervising the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|Indian Lostbelt]] with his servant [spoiler][[Ashwatthama (fate)|]][/spoiler]
* [[Kirschtaria Wodime]], supervising the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|Greek Lostbelt]] with his servants [[Caenis (fate)|]], [spoiler][[Castor (fate)|]], and [[Pollux (fate)|]][/spoiler]
* [[Beryl Gut]], supervising the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] with his servant [spoiler][[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]][/spoiler]
* [[Daybit Sem Void]], supervising the [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|South American Lostbelt]] with his servant [spoiler][[Tezcatlipoca (fate)|]][/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[Foreign Disciples (fate/grand order)|]]

title: tockle_(dq11)
body: A race of beings in [[Dragon Quest XI]]. They are small, rounded creatures with noodly appendages, solid black eyes, and a vertical black mark where its nose would be. They are semi-transparent and appear to fade in and out of existence at random. They are usually bluish-white, but can come in a variety of colors.

title: patriotism
body:
Posts that pay tribute and/or glorify a certain country or nation, real or fictional, regardless of whether the post is genuine or simply [[satire]]. Posts with patriotic motifs usually feature the country's national [[flag]], [[map]], [[military]], or other symbols associated with that country in particular. 

Note that posts that featuring character wearing national [[flag print]] clothing or merely featuring the national [[flag]] is not sufficient to qualify for this tag. Other aforementioned symbolism mentioned above should also be present to emphasize the country or nation in question.

h4. See also

* [[propaganda]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Patriotism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patriotism] & "Nationalism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nationalism]

body: A [[kaiju]] from [[Godzilla the Series]], the child of the first [[Zilla]]. Dr. [[Niko Tatopoulos]] adopted him as his son.

title: rick_(dqb2)
body:
[B]Rick[/b] is a [[soldier]] in [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]] that players can encounter. He is referred to as [b]Warwick[/b] in the English localization.

[Spoilers] He is later revealed to be an antagonist that purposely sewed discord amongst his peers so he could become a monster as a means to avoid death. He is granted the form of a [[Silvapithecus]] and is shortly after slain by the player. [/spoilers]

title: silvapithecus
body: The Silvapithecus, known in Japan as the Silver Devil, is a recurring monster in the [[Dragon Quest]] series. The monster is characterized by their ape-like appearance, [[white fur]], and [[bat wings]].

title: valerie_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Valerie[/b], known as [b]Mache[/b] (マーシュ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

A unique Trainer in both looks and mannerisms, she began designing Pokémon-inspired clothes in the hope that someday she could become a Pokémon.

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. She wears [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[purple choker|purple]] [[choker]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] with [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[footwear ribbon|ribbons]].

title: illusion_cake
body:
A type of cake made to resemble something which isn't a cake. This type of cake became a [[meme]] after a sudden surge in popularity of videos that featured people recreating mundane objects out of cake and cutting them, most predominantly on TikTok.
This made people "paranoid", wondering if everything could be made out of cake.

But then, what's the cake made out of?

body: The Swingre is a recurring monster in the [[Dragon Quest]] series. They appear as [[muscular]] humanoid men with [[purple skin]], [[white hair]], and beards. They often wield weapons resembling a [[morning star]].

title: megami_tensei
body:
The overarching Megami Tensei franchise of Japanese RPGs primarily developed and published by [[Atlus]]. The franchise consists of a series of Mainline games and numerous spin-off games and series. The first games are based on the novel series [[Digital Devil Story]].

Most games in the franchise, including some spinoff games/series, are standalone stories with recurring themes of philosophy, religion, occultism, and [[science fiction]]. The ability to recruit and use [[demon (megami tensei)|]]s in combat is common in multiple series and games.

h4. Series/Games

* [[Digital Devil Story]] - Original novel series
* [[Megami Tensei (Famicom)]] & [[Megami Tensei II]] - Original [[Famicom]] games
** [[Kyuuyaku Megami Tensei]] - Enhanced [[Super Famicom]] port of both games combined
* [[Shin Megami Tensei]] - Mainline series starting from the Super Famicom games

h4. Branch Series/Games

* [[Devil Summoner (series)|]] franchise
* [[Devil Survivor (series)|]] series
* [[Digital Devil Saga]] duology
* Jack Bros
* [[Last Bible]]
* [[Majin Tensei]] series
* [[Persona]] franchise
* [[Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children]]

h4. See also

* [[Demon (Megami Tensei)]] - general tag for the recurring demons in the franchise
* [[List of Shin Megami Tensei Demons]] - list of recurring demons in the franchise

title: c-22
body:
C-22 was issued as a pilot for SMD-24-OX "五月雨 (Samidare)" According to the data, she is a female humanoid made by M.R.S (Machine manufacture Research and development System), who worked on developing the SDM series. Furthermore, it is hard for people to notice that she is not human unless not only judged by her physical appearance. She has to protect the humanity by going on dangerous missions in SMD-24-OX, which include a testing against the biomechanical construct Sylphid, an encounter with Anareta, the defense system of long-ruined space outpost Tetra-Biblos, and an encounter with the SMD series prototype, SMD-00x...
* !post #7045487


https://touhou.fandom.com/wiki/C-22

They specialize in courier delivery and transportation, carrying a high-tech [[suitcase]] with concealed weapons for self-defense. title: ramirez_do_everything_(meme)
body:
An internet [[meme]] born out from the 2009 game [[Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2]]. In the game, Sgt. Foley orders the player, as James Ramirez, to perform various tasks no less than 56 times, such as marking targets for artillery strikes or blowing up enemy vehicles or rescuing VIPs. The [[meme]] involves Ramirez being ordered to perform a variety of bizarre or impossible tasks, such as "Ramirez, destroy that nuke with a knife."

Unless this [[meme]] has a crossover with something Japanese, its off-topic and shouldn't be posted.

Porter Weston Robinson is an American DJ, singer, and songwriter most known for his debut LP [[Worlds (porter robinson)|]] and the music video to his single [[Shelter_(song)|]].
