title: cat_lingerie
body:
A cat-themed [[lingerie]] set gone viral from "this tweet":[https://twitter.com/pomupome1/status/690301705083191296] on January 31st, 2016. The core of the set consists of a [[frilled bra]] with a [[cat cutout|kitten head shaped]] [[cleavage cutout]] and [[cat ear panties]]. The panties are typically [[side-tie_panties|side-tied]], commonly have cat paws on the ends of the ties, and normally feature a [[paw print]] or [[cat cutout|cutout]] on the back. A [[jingle bell]] [[neck bell|collar]] and [[cat ear legwear|cat-themed]] [[thighhighs]] also frequently appear with the core pieces of the set.

Front & back example of the set (top, panties, and choker): post #2256801

Sometimes may also be known as "例の下着":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BE%8B%E3%81%AE%E4%B8%8B%E7%9D%80] or [i]that[/i] underwear, much in the same manner as the [[open-chest sweater]] and [[virgin killer sweater]].

h4. See also

* [[open-chest sweater]]
* [[virgin killer sweater]]
* [[virgin killer outfit]]
* [[front zipper swimsuit (realise)|]]
* [[rei no himo]]
* [[rei no mizugi]]

h4. External links

* Pixivision: "Cat-Inspired Lingerie!":[http://www.pixivision.net/en/a/1054]

* KnowYourMeme: "Cat Keyhole Lingerie":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/cat-keyhole-lingerie]
* RocketNews24: "Clever and cute cat keyhole bra is only one-fourth of lingerie set’s feline charms":[http://en.rocketnews24.com/2016/01/25/clever-and-cute-cat-keyhole-bra-is-only-one-fourth-of-lingerie-sets-feline-charms-%e3%80%90photos%e3%80%91/]

title: virgin_killer_outfit
body:
A specific outfit that has gone viral from "this tweet":[https://twitter.com/key774/status/617886788997152768]:
[quote]

飲み会とかで何回か童貞を殺す服を見てきたけどやっぱりダントツはNO.S PROJECTのブラウスとかスカートとかそのへん
[/quote]

[quote]

I have, on multiple occasions, seen various "virgin killer" outfits at drinking parties and such, but by far the best ones have got to be those blouses, skirts, etc from NO.S PROJECT, and the like.
[/quote]

Many variations exist of the outfit described as "virgin killer", but the most frequent articles of clothing include dark-colored [[high-waist skirt]]s, [[suspender skirt]]s, or [[corset]]s that come up to the [[underbust]] height in order to emphasize the breasts. They are usually worn with [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]]s.

Notably similar to [[Shidare Hotaru]]'s costume from [i][[Dagashi Kashi]][/i]. To a lesser extent, they are also similar to the [[Anna Miller]] and [[Kobeya]] waitress uniforms.

Not to be confused with [[virgin killer sweater]], despite them sharing the same naming inspiration.

h4. See also

The film established several conventions that have stuck in multiple succeeding entries such as [[Bumblebee (transformers)|]] being mute and having a muscle car as his vehicle mode, and having original series [[voice actor|voice actor]] Peter Cullen reprise his role as [[Optimus Prime]].

title: james_cameron
body:
[b]James Francis Cameron[/b] (born on August 16, 1954) is a Canadian director of two of the highest grossing films of all time.

He is also famous for many [[science fiction]] films he has directed during his career. In March 7, 2012, Cameron became the third person to reach "Challenger Deep":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Challenger_Deep], the Earth's deepest point.

h4. Main filmography

* [[The Terminator]]
* [[Aliens (1986)|]]
* [[Titanic (movie)|]]
* [[avatar (2009 movie)|Avatar]]

title: prometheus_(movie)
body:
[b]Prometheus[/b] is a 2012 [[science fiction]] horror film directed by Ridley Scott and written by Jon Spaihts and Damon Lindelof. The film stars [[Noomi Rapace]], [[Michael Fassbender]], Guy Pearce, Idris Elba, Logan Marshall-Green and Charlize Theron. 

Set in the late 21st century, the story centers on the crew of the [[spacecraft]] Prometheus as they follow a star map discovered among the remnants of several ancient Earth civilizations. Led to a distant world and an advanced extraterrestrial civilization, the crew seeks the origins of humanity, but instead discovers a threat that could cause the extinction of the human race.

The film began development in the early 2000s as a fifth entry in the Alien franchise, with both Scott and director [[James Cameron]] developing ideas for a film that would serve as a prequel to Scott's 1979 science fiction horror film [[alien (1979)|Alien]]. James Cameron eventually left the project to focus in his sci-fi film [[avatar (2009 movie)|Avatar]].

By late 2010, Ridley Scott brought Lindelof onto the project to rewrite Spaihts' script, and together they developed a separate story that precedes the story of Alien but is not directly connected to that franchise. According to Scott, though the film shares "strands of Alien's DNA, so to speak", and takes place in the same universe, Prometheus explores its own mythology and ideas.

Prometheus was released on June 1, 2012, in the United Kingdom and parts of Europe and June 8, 2012 in the United States and Canada. It was released on August 24, 2012 in Japan.

h4. Characters

title: avatar_(2009_movie)
body:
[b]Avatar[/b] is a 2009 [[science fiction]] film written and directed by [[James Cameron]], starring Sam Worthington as [[Jake Sully]] and Zoe Saldana as [[Neytiri]]. 

The film is set in the mid 22nd century, when humans are mining a precious mineral called unobtanium on Pandora, a lush habitable moon of a gas giant in the Alpha Centauri star system. The expansion of the mining colony threatens the continued existence of a local tribe of [[Na'vi]], a humanoid [[alien]] species indigenous to Pandora. 

The film's title refers to the genetically engineered Na'vi clones that serve as avatars to the minds of remotely located humans, and are used to interact with the natives and environment of Pandora.

Avatar was internationally released on December 2009 to critical acclaim and commercial success. The film broke several box office records during its release and became the highest-grossing film of all time in North America and worldwide, surpassing [[Titanic (movie)|]]. The film held this record for ten years until the worldwide release of [[Avengers: Endgame]].

Following the film's success, Cameron signed with 20th Century Fox to produce two sequels, making Avatar the first of a planned trilogy.

Not to be confused with [[Avatar Legends]].

title: digimon:_the_movie
body:
[b]Digimon: The Movie[/b] is 2000 compilation movie produced by 20th Century Fox for their Fox Kids division. It amalgates [[Digimon Adventure (1999 Movie)|]], [[Digimon Adventure: Bokura no War Game]], and around 20% of [[Digimon Adventure 02: Digimon Hurricane Jouriku!! Chouzetsu Shinka!! Ougon no Digimental]], with all of the music being replaced with a new score from composers Udi Harpaz and Amotz Plessner. There are also, more notably, musical stings from popular bands at the time, like Smash Mouth and Barenaked Ladies.

The film was created as an attempt to cash in on the success of Pokémon the First Movie in the United States and elsewhere in the western world.

Need for Speed (NFS) is a racing video game franchise published by [[Electronic Arts]]. The first four games in the series were retitled as [b]Over Drivin'[/b] in Japan, before switching to the NFS branding.

The series centers around illicit street racing and in general tasks players to complete various types of races while evading the local law enforcement in police pursuits.

A [[need for speed (2014 movie)|live action film]] based on the series was released in 2014.

title: ghost_costume
body:
Any [[costume]] that resembles a [[ghost]]. 

This may consist of [[sheet ghost|a white sheet with eye holes cut out]], or a [[white cloak|white]] [[hooded cloak]]. 

In addition to this, Japanese media often depicts ghosts in Buddhist burial clothing, called shinishozoku. This often includes a simple [[white kimono]] with a collar folded right-over-left to denote death, as well as a white [[triangular headpiece]]. 

Characters might also be depicted alongside floating fire-shaped orbs called [[hitodama]]. The character might be also do a [[ghost pose]] by raising their hands and allowing their wrists to dangle loosely.

h4. Examples
* !post #6809891
* !post #7546914: [[shiroshouzoku]]

title: obelix
body:
Obelix I (French: Obélix) is the deuteragonist of the [[Asterix and Obelix]] franchise. He works as a menhir sculptor and deliveryman, and is [[Asterix|Asterix's]] best friend. Obelix is noted for his obesity, the menhirs he carries around on his back and his superhuman strength. He is the only Gaul in Asterix' village who is always strong since he fell into the cauldron with magic potion when he was a small boy. Because of Obelix' already enormous strength he is not allowed to drink the magic potion ever again, much to his chagrin. Other characteristics are his simple-mindedness, his love and care for his dog Dogmatix, his anger when someone refers to him as being "fat", his enthusiasm for hunting and eating wild boars and beating up Romans. His catch phrase is: "These Romans are crazy", although usually he considers other nationalities just as strange.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7593728: Asterix on the right Obelix on the left

h4. External links

* https://asterix.fandom.com/wiki/Obelix

title: asterix_and_obelix
body:
Asterix (French: Astérix or Astérix le Gaulois [asteʁiks lə ɡolwa], "Asterix the Gaul"; also known as Asterix and Obelix in some adaptations or The Adventures of Asterix) is a French comic album series about a Gaulish village which, thanks to a magic potion that enhances strength, resists the forces of [[Julius Caesar]]'s Roman Republic Army in a nonhistorical telling of the time after the Gallic Wars. Many adventures take the titular hero [[Asterix]] and his friend [[Obelix]] to Rome and beyond. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asterix

body: In [[Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days]], it appears as a weapon for [[riku (kingdom hearts)|Riku]], and can be upgraded to the Oblivion+. It also appears as half of [[Roxas]]’s dual set of Keyblades alongside the [[Oathkeeper]], and was transformed from the second [[Kingdom Key]] Roxas obtained [spoiler]after absorbing [[Xion (Kingdom Hearts)|]][/spoiler]. Fundamentally, the Oblivion is symbolic of [[sora (kingdom hearts)|Sora]]'s memories of [[riku (kingdom hearts)|Riku]].

title: dark_meta_knight
body:
[[meta_knight|Meta Knight's]] dark counterpart, debuting in [i][[kirby & the amazing mirror|Kirby & The Amazing Mirror]][/i]. The game's story begins when he defeats his blue reflection and shatters the [[Dimension Mirror]], not before slashing at [[Kirby]] and creating three extra copies of him.

[spoiler]He makes a surprise return in [i][[kirby:_triple_deluxe|Kirby: Triple Deluxe]][/i], where he serves as the final boss of Dededetour, as well as the penultimate boss of the True Arena.[/spoiler]

He also appears in [i][[Kirby Star Allies]][/i] as a Dream Friend. He is part of the second wave of post-launch Dream Friends alongside [[Daroach]], [[Adeleine]], and [[ribbon_(kirby)|Ribbon]].
H4. External links
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Dark_Meta_Knight

title: kirby_&_the_amazing_mirror
body:
The first mainline [[Kirby (series)|]] game on the [[Game Boy Advance]], and the second GBA Kirby game overall after [[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land|Nightmare in Dream Land]]. It introduces four-player co-op to the series and appears to try to combine the slower pace of [[Kirby's Adventure]] with the varied movesets of copy abilities ala [[Kirby Super Star]].

High above Dream Land, there is a [[dimension mirror|]] that acts as a portal to the Mirror World. One day, the Mirror World is attacked by a dark force and [[Meta Knight]] sets out to investigate.

Meanwhile, [[Kirby]] is out strolling in the spring breeze when [[Dark Meta Knight]] suddenly attacks him, splitting him into four. Confused, Kirby and his new clones follow the attacker to the Mirror World.

h4. Characters

Goombella is a smart and sassy but friendly [[Goomba]] and the first companion to join [[Mario]] on his quest. body:
[b]Pa-Patch[/b] is a [[Bob-omb]] character that appears in [i][[Paper Mario: The Thousand-year Door]][/i]. He is a large purple Bob-omb with an [[eyepatch]], and his wind-up key resembles a set of bones Pa-Patch's name is derived from his distinctive [[eyepatch]] and the style of his species name. In the English localization, he speaks with a Cockney accent.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Pa-Patch":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Pa-Patch]

title: super_mario_rpg
body:
[i]Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars[/i] is an RPG co-developed by [[square enix|Squaresoft]] and [[Nintendo]], originally released for the Super Famicom and SNES in 1996. 
Received a remake in 2023 for [[Nintendo Switch]], dropping the [i]Legend of the Seven Stars[/i] subtitle.

Not to be confused with [i]Paper Mario RPG[/i] or [i][[Mario & Luigi RPG]][/i], the Japanese names for [i][[Paper Mario: The Thousand-year Door]][/i] and  [i][[Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga]][/i], respectively.

title: shadow_queen
body: The true antagonist and final boss of [[Paper Mario: The Thousand-year Door]]. She is a powerful [[demon]] who laid waste to an ancient civilization thousands of years ago. Her true form is that of a [[ghost]]-like figure with [[starry_sky_print|star-like particles coursing through her]]. She [[possessed|possesses]] the body of [[Princess Peach]] during her battle.

title: vivian_(paper_mario)
body:
A Shadow Siren from [[Paper Mario: The Thousand-year Door]]. First confirmed transgender character in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] - the English localization of the original game changed this, but it was restored in the remake. 

She is a ghost with [[purple skin]] and [[ghost tail|a tail instead of legs]], long curly [[pink hair]], and a striped [[witch hat]].

Vivian is very shy and self-conscious. Her sisters, particularly [[Beldam]], constantly belittle her by calling her male terms despite her protests, though she is too shy to stand up for herself. She defects from her sisters to join [[Mario]]'s party and [spoilers]ultimately help him defeat her supposed master, the [[Shadow Queen]][/spoilers], learning to respect herself more along the way.

h4. External links

* "Mario Wiki: Vivian":https://www.mariowiki.com/Vivian
other_names: ビビアン(ペーパーマリオRPG)

body: Glinda is a fictional character created by L. Frank Baum for his Oz novels. She first appears in Baum's 1900 children's classic [[the wizard of oz|The Wonderful Wizard of Oz]], and is the most powerful sorceress in the Land of Oz, ruler of the Quadling Country South of the Emerald City, and protector of Princess Ozma.

title: farmworld_finn
body:
An alternate universe version of [[Finn the Human]] that lives in a relatively normal world. After using the Ice Crown, he begins to lose his sanity and tries to turn his home into a frozen wasteland.

He has a [[long nose]] and wide eyes thanks to not being born in the irradiated world after the Great Mushroom War, but still has misshapen teeth. Like many alternate Finns, his right arm is [[single mechanical arm|mechanical]]. Also known as "Farmworld Finn" and "Ice Finn".

Notable members are [[Barracuda Joe]], [[Twitch (shantae)|]] and [[Vinegar (shantae)|]].

title: the_liberator_wraith
body:
A [[official alternate costume|legendary skin]] for [[Wraith (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]]. In this appearance Wraith is [[bald female|bald]] and wears a grey [[straitjacket]] over [[black pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], as well as a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]].

This skin is notoriously known as Wraith's "sweat skin," as the lack of her signature hair bun makes her slightly harder to spot by enemy teams, in turn making this appearance very popular among e-sports and ranked players looking for every possible advantage they can get.

title: terastallization
body:
A battle mechanic introduced in [[pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]].

[quote]This phenomenon is found only in the Paldea region and makes [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] shine and glimmer like [[gem]]s.
When a Pokémon Terastallizes, a Tera Jewel appears above the Pokémon’s head like a crown, and the Pokémon’s body glistens like a cut gemstone.
 
All Pokémon in Paldea can Terastallize to gain special powers, and Terastallization allows players to enhance their battle strategies by increasing the power of any [[pokemon move|moves]] that have the same type as their Pokémon’s Tera Type. There are 18 types, meaning there are countless combinations of Pokémon and Tera Types.
 
Players can Terastallize a Pokémon once per [[pokemon battle|battle]] and the transformation will last until the battle ends. Players will need a [[Tera Orb]] to Terastallize a Pokémon, which will need to be recharged after each use. Players can charge their Tera Orb by touching [[crystal]]s overflowing with Terastal energy or by going to a [[pokemon center|Pokémon Center]].[/quote]

title: ai_tenchi_muyou!
body:
This a new [[Tenchi Muyou!]] series, which is basically a set of 50 5-minute product placements for Takahashi City in Japan, who are funding it. It seems only vaguely related to the original series from the info we've seen so far.

There is a new [[Masaki Tenchi]], who looks a bit less scraggly, but is recognizable. The harem has been rotated out (like tires) for a new ridiculously strong ogregirl [[Kinojyou Beni]] and student council president [[Kawanagare Momo]].

Character design is by noted [[zettai ryouiki]] fetishist [[Yasuda Suzuhito]] of [[Yozakura Quartet]], [[Devil Survivor 1]], and [[Durarara!!]] fame.

title: foodification
body:
A specific form of [[objectification]] where a character is portrayed as any type of [[food]].

Only use this tag when the food is an [b]animate, live object[/b]. If the food is themed after a character, and looks like something you could actually eat, use [[character-themed food]] instead.

title: candy_gore
body:
Genre of [[guro]]-adjacent art that depicts violence and gore in brightly colored, dream-like, sugary scenes. Various sweets are often used as replacements for organs, and blood is often an unnatural color (either bright or pastel), and may sparkle. Despite the name, it is not limited to only involving [[candy]], as [[fruit]] and [[cake]] are also often used, such as having a character being cut open to reveal one of the two inside.

When not directly involving food, the genre stays very detached from any sense of realism - blood will be thick, shiny and gooey, and often shown dripping between perfectly neat segmented slices of flesh. Realistic guro with discolored blood would not qualify for this tag, and a lot of this tag would not qualify for guro due to its unrealistic nature.

h4. See also
* [[alternate body fluid]]
* [[body horror]]
* [[ero guro]]
* [[illusion cake]]
* [[horror (theme)]]
* [[injury]]
* [[surreal]]
* [[yami kawaii]]

title: karlach
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member.

Karlach is a female [[tiefling]] barbarian who was sold to the archdevil Zariel to become her prized soldier.

Her heart has been replaced by an Infernal Engine, making her burst into flames if under extreme emotion, [spoilers]But her heart can't survive outside of Avernus and will kill her if she doesn't return. [/spoilers]

title: raver
body:
[[Rave party]]-goers. Associated with the phrase "PLUR" (Peace-Love-Unity-Respect), [[drugs]], and electronic music.

Attire worn by ravers is often colorful and made of synthetic materials, as well as highly revealing, due to the tendency for these events to be hot and uncomfortable. [[Pasties]] are a particularly common sight. Common accessories include plastic [[bead bracelet]]s ("kandi"), [[fur leg warmers]], [[fishnet gloves]] and [[pacifier]] necklaces. They also often carry [[glowstick]]s and wear glow jewelry.

h4. Examples

* !post #9311603

Subject of the [[SCP Foundation]].

title: grand_theft_auto_vi
body:
[b]Grand Theft Auto VI[/b] is an action-adventure video game being developed by "Rockstar Games":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockstar_Games. 

The game's setting marks the return of Miami-inspired Vice City, and has been expanded into the fictional open world state of Leonida, based on the state of [[Florida (location)|]], [[United States]]. The game was formally revealed on December 5, 2023 and was originally set to be released sometime in 2025 for the [[Xbox Series X|Xbox Series X/S]] and [[Playstation 5]]. However, on May 2, 2025, it was announced the game would be delayed and instead will be released next year on May 26, 2026.

h4. See also

* [[Grand Theft Auto]]
* [[Grand Theft Auto: Vice City]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Grand Theft Auto VI":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Theft_Auto_VI

* "The official Grand Theft Auto VI Trailer 2 on YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VQRLujxTm3c

title: grand_theft_auto_iv
body:
The tenth game of the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series, released in 2008. It marks the debut of the HD Universe, a separate timeline from its predecessors being the 3D Universe. The game is set in Liberty City but most of its islands, streets and areas names are changed along with a few map layout changes.

The story revolves around [[Niko Bellic]], a Serbian veteran who has moved into Liberty City to start a new life from his past war and experience the American Dream along with his cousin, Roman Bellic. Along his journey to get to the dream, he has made friends and enemies alike.

It has two episodic expansion packs, [i]The Lost and Damned[/i] and [i]The Ballad of Gay Tony[/i], each released in 2009, their respective protagonists being [[Johnny Klebitz]] and [[Luis Lopez]].
other_names: グランドセフトオート4

title: major_(hellsing)
body:
[b]The Major[/b] is the supreme commander of the organization known as Millennium, and the main antagonist of the [[Hellsing]] series. A former Nazi who served during the Second World War, the Major is characterized by an all-consuming obsession with war in all of its aspects. He does not care for the reasons behind any war, and appears to have no political or ideological leanings, and wishes only to wage war for all eternity.

His real name is never mentioned in the series proper, although a few easter eggs point to his name being Montina Max, the name of a character from Kouta Hirano's previous series [i]Coyote: Hangyaku no Resistance[/i] who served as the basis for the Major. A booklet for Hellsing Ultimate V states that his name may or may not be Montina Max.
other_names: モンティナ・マックス

title: captain_(hellsing)
body:
[b]The Captain[/b] is the bodyguard of [[major_(hellsing)|The Major]] and member of the Millennium Organization. A former member of the Waffen-SS, the Captain is a natural werewolf, with the ability to transform between his human and werewolf forms at will.

Fans commonly refer to him as Hans Gunsche, the name of a character from the one-shot manga [i]Desert Guardian[/i] who most likely served as the basis for the Captain. However, this is not an official name used in any media.

* !post #5387281

title: istina_(arknights)
body:
[i]Istina, member of Ursus Student Self-government Group, will beat the enemy with Originium Arts chosen from one of her books[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Anna Morozova[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 22[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]156 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A founder and member of Ursus Student Self-Governing Group along with [[Zima_(Arknights)|Zima]] and [[Gummy_(Arknights)|Gummy]]. She and her group took refuge at Rhodes Island during the fall of Chernobog at the end of Episode One. A cool-headed and rational, though somewhat introverted bookworm. She also provides intel and data processing services for Rhodes Island. She attacks by firing magic missiles from her book.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Children of Ursus[/i].

Her motif is based on spectacled bears. Her callsign "Истина" means [i]"Truth"[/i], or [i]"True"[/i] in Russian.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Yuuki Aoi]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3847139: Default
* !post #3847147: Elite II

title: xenoblade_chronicles_x
body:
Science fiction RPG in the [[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]] series.

It first released for the [[Wii U]] in 2015, with a [[Nintendo Switch|Switch]] remaster released on March 20, 2025.

h4. Characters

* [[Cross (xenoblade x)|]] (customizable player)

title: lgbt_pride
body:
An image whose main focus or theme is LGBT pride.

Common examples include characters holding LGBT flags, wearing LGBT-themed makeup or clothing, displaying [[rainbow]]-themed imagery, or commemorating [[Pride Month]], a holiday observed in June in various countries.

LGBT is an abbreviation for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender. These terms are used to describe a person's sexual orientation or gender identity. Other common terms include LGBTQ or LGBTQ+, with Q meaning "queer" or "questioning" and the + added in recognition of all non-straight or non-cisgender identities.

title: max_verstappen
body:
[b]Max Emilian Verstappen[/b] (b. 30 September 1997) is a Dutch racing driver and four-time [[Formula One]] World Champion who has been competing in the highest-class Formula category since 2015. Notable holder of many records in F1 history, having won 10 races in a row and 19 in a single season, Verstappen has claimed his four consecutive world titles with [[Red Bull|Red Bull Racing]].

In 2023, Max Verstappen would end up becoming a [[meme]] subject, as his 2023 Monaco Grand Prix pole time graphic (paired with his personal theme, 33 Max Verstappen, by Carte Blanq & Maxx Power) would be used as a representation of doing something quickly. His Austrian Grand Prix and Qatar Grand Prix pole times from the same year would see similar use.

h6. Teams
[table]
[tbody]
[tr][td]Toro Rosso[/td][td]2015-2016[/td][/tr]
[tr][td][[Red Bull]][/td][td]2016-[/td][/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: michael_schumacher
body:
[b]Michael Schumacher[/b] (b. 3 January 1969) is a German former racing driver and seven-time [[Formula One]] World Champion who has competed in the highest-class Formula category from 1991 to 2006, returning briefly between 2010 and 2012, before retiring from the sport.

He holds the joint-record for the most championships with [[Lewis Hamilton]]. Schumacher has won his first two consecutive titles with Benetton, while claiming the next five in a row (also a record) with [[Ferrari]].

On 29 December 2013, Schumacher suffered a severe brain injury in a skiing accident. Since he was discharged from hospital in September 2014 and enter private rehabilitation at his home, Schumacher has not been seen by the public to this day and his current medical condition is still unknown.

[expand=F1 Teams]
[table]
[tbody]

[tr][td][[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes]][/td][td]2010-2012[/td][/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

title: lewis_hamilton
body:
[b]Sir Lewis Hamilton[/b] (b. 7 January 1985) is a British racing driver and seven-time [[Formula One]] World Champion who has been competing in the highest-class Formula category since 2007.

His records include claiming the most race wins, pole positions and podiums in F1, as well as holding the joint-record for the most championships with [[Michael Schumacher]]. Hamilton has won his first title with [[McLaren]] and the rest with [[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes]].

title: lady_reines_case_files
body:
[b]Phantasmal Collection Realm: Patchwork London[br]Lady Reines Case Files[/b]
[quote]The train stops in London's past. Standing at the center of the city is the Clock Tower, an ivory tower built by the obsessive, where mages proudly call their institution the essence of knowledge. It is a city brimming with magecraft and Mystics, where conspiracy and conflict cycle endlessly in pursuit of the Root.

And in this world of mages, at a simple flat, an encounter with a living Lord and a dead Lord... The smell of blood in the air signals the beginning of a new mystery, a new case.

"Hm? Of course you're going to cooperate. Don't tell me you're going to abandon a frail, defenseless young lady, are you?"[/quote]

A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]], released on the Japanese server on April 27, 2019 and on the NA server on April 30, 2021. [[Gray (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.
